main event: On June 10, 1968, multiple witnesses observed a solid-looking round object with a silver appearance over Dayton, Ohio.
interesting points: The object had a red antenna underneath that moved back and forth,The sighting lasted approximately 30 minutes, and the course of the object was north to ENE., It reflected sunlight, giving it a shiny appearance., The conclusion from the investigation suggested it was probably a weather balloon,Interestingly, the observers included civilians, implying a level of community awareness.
sighted object: a solid-looking round object with a silver appearance
witness description: witnesses included a mix of civilians, including individuals aged from 9 to 54
